name: Embassy Suites San Luis Obispo

reviews.text: This hotel was ok. it was kind of hard to find off the 101 freeway central coast area.
reviews.title: Older embassy suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was clean and I would stay there again, but in comparison to other embassy suites it was older and dated.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: It is connected to a shopping area and a Tahoe Joes which was nice- we didn't have to drive anywhere.
reviews.title: San Luis Obispo is awesome!

reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Embassy, and we were not disappointed. The suite was large, clean, and had a small refrigerator and microwave. The reservation comes with their full breakfast and their happy hour with two complimentary drinks . The staff was wonderful--you could tell they really enjoyed working at the Embassy. The bartender at the happy hour gave us wonderful informaton about having dinner at the restaurant. It is located in a shopping area with several shops nearby, a grocery store, and a Star Bucks! It is just a short drive to the downtown area. We always walk along the creek and really suggest lunch or dinner on the patios overlooking it. Thursday nights there is a great Farmer's Market with food and music. The beach areas are also close by. We definately suggest a stay at the San Luis Obispo Embassy Suites and will be taking our own advise the next time we are in that area.
reviews.title: Functional upscale spot with an amazing breakfast
Good hotel, could use a facelift
reviews.text: We stayed here on our trip up the coast. The hotel was packed due to some high school sports tournament were requested and got a room with two queen beds. The room seemed days away from the elevator but that proved to be a blessing when we saw what the kids were up to in the front of the hotel. Check I was quick and we got to our room. As this was half way through the trip we needed to do some laundry. The laundry facilities worked fine. The rooms were comfortable and the queen beds were larger than the double beds we have had in other hotels so that was nice. The rooms could use a facelift, especially the bathrooms. The fridge was also so loud we had to shut it off. The next morning we had the complimentary breakfast which was the best we have had in the last 7 days is staying at Embassy Suites. The staff were helpful and the Internet was only $2.95, a bargain over the other Embassy Suites, although I don't believe any hotel should be charging for Internet in 2012!

I think I really want to give a 3 1/2, but went with a 4 on the strength of the staff service. I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights for a business trip. The hotel was not crowded and they upgraded my room, which was nice. I haven't stayed in SLO before, so don't know what the other options are. This hotel was dated, older carpet in the rooms, and basic furniture. The rooms have a small refrigerator and microwave, as well as a hot water maker. The staff was really friendly and helpful, including making restaurant recommendations. Breakfast service was good too. Location is right at the back of a major shopping center, and right off the 101 freeway. Ask for a room not facing the freeway to avoid freeway noise. The hotel was quiet and the bed comfortable. All in all it worked out well for our purposes.
reviews.title: A bit dated, but great service

reviews.text: I have said before that this hotel is hard to find, but worth the trouble. The front desk people and all of the staff are terrific and very pleasant. They just replaced all of the fitness equipment with the latest and greatest Precor elypticals, treadmills and rower. It is a great workout room right above the pool. While the hotel and staff are fantastic, we noticed this time that the hotel is getting really "tired" looking. The carpeting is worn out, the room case goods are worn and the common areas smelled like smoke, all a bit disappointing. Since we are frequent visitors, it will not stop us from staying there, but I'd they do not upgrade soon, they will start losing business to the newer hotels, including a new Hampton Inn and the newer Marriott.
reviews.title: Always a good experience

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on a business trip. I was very impressed with the staff's willingness to please, and the breakfast was great too. It was my first time taking advantage of Embassy Suites free breakfast, and it's not just pastries and fruit! They have free "cook-to-order" breakfast for omlettes, fresh pancakes, hashbrowns, sausage, bacon, and eggs, as well as the usual bagels, pastries, cereal and fruit. I was stuffed!
reviews.title: I'll probably be back

reviews.text: My family & I have stayed here 3 times between mid Oct-end of Nov 2012. Total of 7 nights. Very clean & exceptionally courteous & eager-to-please staff (most of younger staff apparently are local college students). All rooms have microwaves, refrigerators. Free hotfood, fruit, cereals, breads/muffins breakfast buffet & made to order omelets plus. Mgr Reception 2-hr eve FREE beverages (including well & mixed alcoholic) & appitizers. Indoor hot tub & pool. Only down-side is some room locations could be on noisy side. If this is issue for you, ask for room away from freeway-side.
reviews.title: Mobility Issues?? Stay here

reviews.text: Finding Hotel the first time is definately a challenge, best suggestion I can give you is as you drive up Madonna Rd toward Mtn, the shopping Center is on your left. Pass McDonalds & Starbucks & (if in standard vehicle) turn LEFT AT APPLEBEE's Restaurant (this access road will dead end you into SEARs on your left & back side of EMBASSY Suites on your right). If you are in Motorhome or other oversized vehicle, I'd suggest you pass Applebee's & take the next LEFT turn at the US Post Office (it's another access road, a little bumpy, but is less traveled and takes you directly to front entance of Hotel & shopping center's far end parking lot). Once you get settled, then try other options. There are shopping options galore within a mile of Hotel (at least 5 different shopping centers), including ones with Costco & Trader Joes, & numerous eating options for various budgets, also next door to Market, that also carries speciality foods. That in mind, however, we were VERY pleased with dinners we had at the Hotel's restaurant, when were were just too tired to go out.
reviews.title: Not Bad, but Not Great

reviews.text: If have mobility issues: We stayed in standard suite first visit & Handicapped suites for next 2 visits. They have 2 options for HQ suites both with handrails, (1) roll-in shower & (2) tub/shower, both well set-up, lots of space. Lots of flat, available parking for all types of vehicles (hotel located at rear of large shopping center next to 101 Fwy). Flat level entrance with automated bi-fold front door, ramps to Atrium Courtyard & Bar. Ramp to INDOOR handrailed HOTTUB & Pool on ground floor(only problem here is due to limited space around pool, the pool loungers & chairs sometimes can make it difficult to get to the entrances to hottub & pool without moving these items). There is also a separate large service elevator available for use that will take you to just outside the entrances to the pools & exercise area, if you are on an upper floor away from lobby. The 2 different HQ rooms on 2 different stays that we stayed in were #103 & #108 located on North side away from freeway were Quiet.
reviews.title: Comfortable and friendly

reviews.text: Traveling up to SLO to meet daughter's boyfriend's parents, we wanted a nice place with numerous amenities, and of course, the Embassy Suites always have great amenities. It was Thanksgiving week so the place was booked solid.
reviews.title: Terrific value!

reviews.text: We enjoyed the Happy Hour and the breakfast, both complimentary. Snacks at Happy Hour were sufficient, veggie tray, chips and salsa, popcorn and a Chinese cracker mix as well as an appetizer menu with prices in the average range. Breakfast was either hot, cooked to order or buffet. The only upsetting thing to me was there were dogs in the dining area on Thursday morning. Friday morning, one of the gentleman that works there made sure no one brought their dogs into the dining area. I'm not an animal hater, but to have allowed dogs into the eating area really upset me. The dogs were even in the area at Happy Hour. Management really needs to address this issue, perhaps by posting a sign that states no dogs in the Atrium area.
reviews.title: Older Embassy Suites

reviews.text: Absolutely our favorite hotel in San Luis Obispo (SLO). Went there for a family/college reunion and the full complimentary happy hour and breakfast, awesome rooms, along with a very friendly and professional staff, made our time here PERFECT! I cannot say enough about the staff!!!...from the Hotel Manager, Director of Front Office to the servers and bartenders in the atrium...fantastic! If you find yourself traveling to SLO and you're looking for a place to stay with great amenities, friendly/professional employees, great food and a free happy hour to top it off, the Embassy Suites in SLO is your place. Thanks to everyone at the ES who made our weekend a truly memorable one!
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL, GREAT STAFF...the best in SLO

reviews.text: The hotel has a large atrium and I was unfortunate to have a interior room facing it. It was a bit noisey when there was any activity including breakfast or happy hour. One night some kids decided to do a spontaneous karaoke and I called about the noise and the office went to shut it down. Otherwise I wanted to move to another room. Because I was in the interior I felt like I did not have access to fresh air although I heard from others that the freeway noise was there if you opened the window. I think most rooms had living areas off the atrium with windows so thay all heard the noise.
reviews.title: My room off the atrium was a bit noisey

reviews.text: The rooms are huge with a living area which was good for working. It was clean but a bit aged in the hallways. One problem was that the TV in the living room was not connected to the cable so I needed to watch it in the bedroom. The maid was great with cleaning the room. The staff was very nice.
reviews.title: Beware they change your room type

reviews.text: Breakfast is good with the ability to order custom eggs or an omelette or french toast over the standard scramble eggs, bacon, pancakes, toast, cereal, oatmeal, and fruit. Happy hour is a nice feature. I used the free airport shuttle too. All of this offsets the higher price here versus at other hotels.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with lots of extras

reviews.text: There are a variety of restaurants and shops within walking distance and also a nearby grocery store.
reviews.title: What a bargain!

aka: Embassy Suites San Luis Obispo Hotel
description: Located near SLO Wine country and gorgeous beaches, this hotel is perfect for your San Luis Obispo vacation! All guests receive free breakfast, complimentary cocktails and snacks at the nightly evening reception and spacious, two-room suites. The hotel offers a shuttle to the famous SLO Farmer's market for $4 round-trip every Thursday night. The onsite restaurant, Greenhouse Grill and Cafe, offers delicious Californian cuisine from Executive Chef Kirk Sowell. Enjoy an indoor pool, 24-hour business center, 24-hour fitness center and high speed Internet access.
